msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 41
ab.l: And it was in the course of twoyears, and Pharaoh dreamed: and, lo,he stands by the Nile.
And, lo, there came up out of the Nileseven cows beautiful-looking and plump, andthey fed in the reeds.
And, lo, seven other cowscame up after them out of the river, of bad-lookingand thin, and they stood by the other cowson the bank of the river.
Andthe bad-looking and thin cows ate up the sevenbeautiful-looking and fat cows.And Pharaoh awoke.
And he slept and dreamedthe second time: and, lo, seven ears of grain came up on onestalk, plump and good.
And, lo, seventhin ears and lashed by the east wind sprung upafter them.
And the seven empty ears swallowedthe seven healthy and full ears. AndPharaoh awoke, and, lo, the dream ended.

And it wasin the morning, and his spirit was troubled, and he sent and calledfor all the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men.And he told them his dream, but there was none of them that could interpret |them|to Pharaoh.
Then the superior of the cup-bearers spoketo Pharaoh, saying, ‘I do remember my faultsthis day.
Pharaoh was angry with his servants,and put me under guard in the house of the superior of the executioners,me and the superior of the bakers.
And we dreamed a dream in one night,I and he, we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.

And a young man was there with us, a Hebrew,servant to the superior of the executioners. And we told him, and he interpretedto us our dreams: to each man according to his interpretationhe did interpret.
And it was — as he interpreted to us,so it was: me he restored to my place, and him he hanged.’
And Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they made him runfrom the prison, and he let him shave and changehis clothes, and he came to Pharaoh.
AndPharaoh said to Joseph, ‘I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpretit. And I have heard about you, saying, you understanda dream to interpret it.’
And Joseph answered Pharaoh,saying, ‘It is other than me: God shall restorethe health of Pharaoh.’
And Pharaoh spoketo Joseph, ‘In my dream, lo, I stand on the bankof the Nile:
And, lo, there came up out of the Nile sevencows, plump and beautiful in form and they fedin the reed.
And, lo, seven other cowscame up after them, gaunt and very bad-lookingand thin, such as I never saw in all the landof Egypt for badness.
And the cows,those thin and the ill ate up the first sevenfat cows.
And they went inside them,and it could not be known that they had entered them, but they appearancewas still ill as at the beginning. And I awoke.
And I saw in my dream, and, lo, seven ears came upon one stalk, full and good.
And, lo,seven ears, shrivelled, thin, and lashed by the east windsprung up after them.
Andthe thin ears swallowed the sevengood ears. And I told |this| to the magicians, but there was none that could explainits interpretation to me.’
And Joseph said to Pharaoh,‘The dream of Pharaoh is one: Godhas told Pharaoh what he is doing.
The seven good cowsare seven years, and the seven good ears are sevenyears: the dream is one.
And the seventhin and ill cows that came up after themare seven years, and the seven empty earslashed by the east wind will be seven years of famine.
This is the word which I have spoken to Pharaoh:It has shown to Pharaoh what God is doing.
Lo, sevenyears of great plenty are coming in all the land of Egypt.
And seven years of famine will arise after them, andall the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt, and thefamine will consume all the people of the land.
Andthe plenty will not be known in the land by reason of the famine that will follow,for it will be very severe.
And the doubling ofPharaoh’s, as for that, it is because the word is ready beforeGod, and God hastens to do that.
Now let Pharaoh seek out a man rational and wise, and set him as a superior over the land of Egypt.
Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appointrulers over the land, and take the fifth partover the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.
And let them gather all the grain of those good yearsthat are coming, and gather the grainunder the authority of Pharaoh, let them keep the grain in the cities.
And that food shall be for reserve to the people of the landfor the seven years of famine, which will be in the land of Egypt,that the people of the land may not perish through the famine.’
And the words seemed good in the eyes of Pharaoh, andin the eyes of all his servants.
And Pharaoh saidto his servants, ‘Will we find such a man as this is,a man in whom there is the inspiration of God?’
And Pharaoh saidto Joseph, ‘Since God has let you know about all this,there is none so rational and wise as you are.
Bea superior over my house, and according to your wordshall all my people move. Only by the matters of the thronewill I be greater than you.’
And Pharaoh saidto Joseph, ‘See, I have set you superior over all the landof Egypt.’
And Pharaoh took off his ringfrom his hand, and put it on Joseph’s hand,and clothed him in linen clothing, and put a gold chainon his neck.
And he had him drivenin the second chariot which he had, and they criedin front of him to bow the knee and to make him superior over all the landof Egypt.
And Pharaoh saidto Joseph, ‘I am Pharaoh, and without your authority shall no man lift uphis hand or foot to rule in allthe land of Egypt.’
And Pharaoh called Joseph’s nameZaphenath-Paneah. And he gave him Asenath, daughterof Potiphera, priest of On, for a wife. And thefame of Joseph’s rule went out over all the land of Egypt.
And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood beforePharaoh, king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from beforePharaoh, and passed over all the land of Egypt.
And in the seven plenteous years the earth producedby handfuls.
And he gathered up allthe grain of the seven years, which were in the land of Egypt, andand he put the grain in the cities: he put the grain of the city’s fieldsthat were around it inside of it.
And Joseph gathered grain as the sandof the sea, in great abundance, until he ceased to number it,because it was without number.
And two sons were born to Josephbefore the year of famine came, which Asenath,daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, bore to him.
And Joseph called the name of the firstbornManasseh: ‘Because God has made me forget all my affliction,and all my father’s house.’
And the nameof the second called the Ephraim: ‘Because God has spread mein the land of my affliction.’
And the seven yearsof plenty, that was seven in the land of Egypt, finished.
Andthe seven years of famine started to come, as Joseph had said.And the famine was in all lands, but in all the land of Egyptthere was bread.
And when all the people of the land of Egypt starvedfor bread, and the people cried to Pharaohfor bread, and Pharaoh said to all the peopleof Egypt, ‘Go to Joseph. Do what he says to you.’

And the famine was over all the faceof the earth. And Joseph opened all the treasuries in whichthere was grain, and sold grain to all the people of Egypt.And the famine became stronger in all the land of Egypt.
And all the people of the earth came to Egypt, to Joseph, to buygrain, because the famine became stronger in all lands.

app.note: Reconstructed on the basis of the Hebrew original, H, C, and Gen 41:39–40.
